result.execSummary:
The defendant Auston L. Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay cost of $65.32 (obtain copies of medical records) to be paid joint/several with co-defendants.
Pay additional restitution joint/several with other defendants.  State to have additional 60 days to submit figures and provide this to the defendant and defendant's attorney.

**11/03/14 Per restitution order - Restitution of $18,983.20 plus 10% surcharge of $1,898.32 for a total of $20.881.52.**

Pay court costs which includes the DNA surcharge.
To be paid during period of probation.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Daniel Sanchez and Steven Solis, their families or residences and Iverson Park.
With successful completion of probation, expungment of Count 1 only.

Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
Provide DNA sample. 
State is not requesting any additional jail time.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Auston L. Ortiz in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Auston L. Ortiz in CUSTODY. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF231 and 14CM323.

8:30 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.
Amended Information filed by the State.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Atty Knaapen stated on the record a request for probation with Entry of Judgment of Conviction to be withheld.
Court does not think they have the authority to withhold judgment and is looking for further verification that this would be acceptable.
8:35 a.m.  Court is in adjournment until 9 a.m. so that ADA Knaapen can provide the Court with additional verification to his request.
9:02 a.m.  Court is back in session.
Atty Knaapen has provided the Court with documentation regarding the authority for the Court to withhold Entry of Judgment of Conviction and reviews with parties involved in courtroom.  Court is not inclined to withhold Entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Court has informed the defendant that the Court is not inclined to follow the plea agreement reached.
Atty Knaapen makes statements regarding the "Wallenberg Case" and additional statements on the record regarding the deferred agreement.
Atty Mcfarland does not have any comments.
9:07 a.m.  Court is in recess so that the defense attorney's can have time to meet with their clients.
9:15 a.m.  Court is back in session and appearances remain the same.
Atty Knaapen defer's to Atty Mcfarland and Atty Mcfarland will continue with the plea.
Prosecutor states plea agreement on the record.
Atty Knaapen states that the victim notification had been made and that they would not be able to attend the hearing today.
Victim had indicated to Atty Knaapen that the jail time was not adequate; victim's had been provided with the opportunity to address the Court and are choosing not to.
Atty Knaapen has not yet provided the defendant's with a total to date for restitution - victim is still receiving medical care at this time.  Atty Knaapen is still needing time to collect additional information on the restitution.
Defendant has received a copy of the Amended Information and waives further reading.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF231:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - No contest

14CM323:
Count 1 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Court reviews the criminal complaints in case 14CF230 and 14CF231.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty in Case 14CF231 of Count 1, 2 and 3 and Case 14CM323 of Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes statements regarding the PSI and that the defendant is to remain in jail until time of sentencing.
Atty Mcfarland makes statements that he thought there would be no PSI and sentencing would take place today.  Atty Mcfarland states that his client should be released on a signature bond as of today's date if a PSI is ordered.  
Court questions where the defendant would be living; Atty Mcfarland states his client is residing with his mother who is in Court today.
Atty Mcfarland has discussed with his client the advantages and disadvantages of not having a PSI.

Parties are ready to proceed to sentencing.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing recommendations.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing recommendations.
Court asks the Defendant if he/she wants to make any statements.
Defendant does not wish to make a statement on his behalf.

BY THE COURT:
14CF231:
Count 1 -
Sentence withheld
Probation for 3 years 
Obtain and maintain full-time employment.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Provide DNA sample
Pay restitution joint/several with other defendants.  State to have additional 60 days to submit figures and provide this to the defendant and defendant's attorney.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Daniel Sanchez and Steven Solis, their families or residences and Iverson Park.
Perform 80 hours of community service.
Pay court costs which includes the DNA surcharge
With successful completion of probation expungement of the felony count only (Count 1 on case 14CF231) the misdemeanor count's will remain on his record.
State is not requesting any additional jail time.
Credit for jail time served of 117 days.
Pay cost of $65.32 (obtain copies of medical records) - paid joint/several with co-defendants

Count 2 - 
Sentence withheld
Probation for 24 months
Comply with terms of probation in Count 1
Pay Court costs; paid during term of probation

Count 3 -
Sentence withheld
Probation for 24 months
Comply with terms of probation in Count 1
Pay Court costs; paid during term of probation

14CM323:
Count 1 - 
Probation for 2 years
Comply with terms of probation in 14CF231
Pay Courts costs which includes drug abuse surcharge; paid during term of probation
Plea hearing on September 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on September 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Auston L. Ortiz in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Auston L. Ortiz in custody.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Frank Martinez in court with attorney Adam Raabe. Defendant Frank Martinez in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:32 a.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record.  This is a joint motion hearing.
This a motion hearing and potential motions.  
This is a motion for joinder.  Attorney McFarland has received and Attorney Raabe has received the motion as well.
Attorney McFarland states there is an objection to joinder but Attorney Raabe states there is no objection.
ADA Knaapen states the states position on the record.
Attorney McFarland states its objection on the record.  Defendant was the only person with driver's license.
Court questions the 5th amendment right at sentencing.  
Attorney Knaapen responds to the defense' statement.   
Court questions - Neither defendant made a statement to the police.    Attorney McFarland makes a response to the court.
Court states its findings on the record.  
BTC:
The court grants the states motion for joinder.  Both matter will be tried starting 10-1-2014.

Motion to exclude evidence
ADA Knaapen states that discovery has been sent to both defense counsel.  
Attorney Raabe states he has received the discovery.  He would like extension to file motions.  
Court questions the reason for length of time that discovery was sent out.  ADA Knaapen responds to the same.  

Court denies the motion to exclude.  However the court will point out that discovery needs to be provided in a timely manner and it has a duty to supplement any discovery immediately.

Motions due by September 17, 2014

11:51 a.m. court is in recess.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
for Extension to File Motions
Defendant's
Motion hearing on September 2, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Jury trial on October 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

14CF230: Defendant Frank Martinez in court with attorney Adam Raabe. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF231: Erik Mcfarland appears in court.  Defendant Auston Ortiz does not appear. 

Court indicates the following matters are heard together for a STATUS CONFERENCE: 14CF230 Frank Martinez and 14CF231 Auston Ortiz.

Court reviews the files.  Has not received a motion for joinder for these files. 
Court sets the Martinez file (14CF230) for a 2 day Jury Trial on 10-01-14 beginning at 8:30 a.m. to honor the speedy trial demand.
Ortiz (14CF231) will also be set for jury trial that day.  If there is no joinder, then Ortiz (14CF231) will be set in the number 2 position. 
Atty Knaapen indicates he can have the joinder motion filed by the end of this week and asks to set a motion date for that. 

Both files: 
Motion to Join is set for September 2, 2014 at 11:30 a.m.    
Any pre-trial motions and proposed jury instructions should be filed by August 22, 2014 on both matters. 

Atty Raabe indicates he has not received discovery as of yet. 
Atty Knaapen will provide the information they have but are waiting on crime lab results and such.  Jury trial scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Application for Search Warrant, Search Warrant and Return of Officer
Status conference on August 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 18, 2014 at 11:30 am.

$5,000 cash bond.  No contact with Daniel Sanchez or Steven Solis.  Must reside at mother's house and obey all household rules.  Follow a curfew of returning to the house by 12:00 a.m. (Midnight) and must not leave the house prior to 5:00 a.m.

Defendant Auston L. Ortiz in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Auston L. Ortiz in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:38 pm case is called.
This is a motion for a reduction of bond.
Appearances stated on the record by ADA C. Cousins.
Attorney McFarland states its position on the record.  Requests a signature bond
ADA make statement to the court.  There are number of cases as a suspect while a juvenile.

Court states Bond is consistent with other parties of this incident.  Mother is in the courtroom.

BTC:
$5,000 cash bond.  No contact with Daniel Sanchez or Steven Solis.  Must reside at mother's house and obey all household rules.  Follow a curfew of returning to the house by 12:00 a.m. (Midnight) and must not leave the house prior to 5:00 a.m.  

Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant/attorney received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.  
Bond Continued

Speedy trial requested by Attorney McFarland.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Arraignment on August 18, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Court calls cases at 3:18 p.m. Defendants are all in custody.  ADA Knaapan calls for all cases to be heard together.
Co-Defendant cases called together for Preliminary Hearing today: 14CF229 Angelo Garcia w/Atty Lloyd, 14CF230 Frank Martinez w/Atty Raabe, 14CF231 Auston Ortiz w/Atty McFarland, 14CF232 Jesus Rangel w/Atty Arendt.
3:19 p.m. ADA Knaapen calls witness, Kent Lepak, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.  Witness identified Defendant Garcia, Defendant Rangel, Defendant Martinez, and Defendant Ortiz as sitting by their respective attorneys.
3:33 p.m. Atty Arendt (Defendant Rangel) cross exam of witness.
3:37 p.m. Atty Lloyd (Defendant Garcia) cross exam of witness.
3:39 p.m. Atty McFarland (Defendant Ortiz) cross exam of witness.
3:42 p.m. Atty Raabe (Defendant Martinez) cross exam of witness.
3:43 p.m. ADA Knaapen redirect.
3:44 p.m. No further testimony.  Witness steps down.
Each attorney will be heard in regards to their respective Defendant.
3:45 p.m. Atty Arendt makes argument that his client is not involved.
3:46 p.m. ADA Knaapen states Defendant Rangel was a party to the crime.  
3:47 p.m. Atty Lloyd no statements.
3:47 p.m. ADA Knaapen  Defendant Garcia did the action of striking.
3:49 p.m. Atty McFarland makes argument that there is not probable cause for Defendant Ortiz and request dismissal.
3:50 p.m. ADA Knaapen states Defendant Ortiz was a party to the crime - get-away car.
3:51 p.m. Atty Raabe makes argument and request dismissal for Defendant Martinez.
3:54 p.m. ADA Knaapen states Defendant was active in striking/hitting and party to the crime.

BTC:   
14CF229 Angelo Garcia 14CF229 Br 1 case: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

14CF231 Auston Ortiz Br 1:   Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

14CF230 Frank Martinez Br 1: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

14CF232 Jesus Rangel Br 1: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

All case to be schedule for Arraignment 08-18-14 at 8:30 am. for 14CF229, 14CF232, 14CF230.  Arraignment for 14CF231 (Ortiz-Atty McFArland) set for 08-18-14 at 11:30 a.m.

Bond on all cases continued.  Arraignment scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
for Reduction of Bond
Atty McFarland
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Erik McFarland in court.  Defendant Auston L. Ortiz appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Veronica Isherwood and Intern Taylor Kraus appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.

Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Auston L. Ortiz in court. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter adjourned to allow time to get an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
No contact with Daniel Sanchez and Steven Solis.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Assault.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions the defendant.  
Defendant is employed at Sues Ginseng.  He has graduated high school. 
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
State requests a $15,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Court questions defendant further.
